course_content.core:
Year 1 Economics Economics 1 
Mathematics 1 
Probability 1 
Statistics 1 Economics 1 Mathematics 1 Probability 1 Statistics 1 Philosophy Ancient Philosophy 
Beginning Philosophy 
Early Modern Philosophy B 
Reason and Argument B Ancient Philosophy Beginning Philosophy Early Modern Philosophy B Reason and Argument B Option modules Philosophy
Ethics 
Knowledge and Perception Philosophy Ethics Knowledge and Perception Year 2 Economics Economics II - Microeconomics 
Economics II - Macroeconomics 
Econometrics II Economics II - Microeconomics Economics II - Macroeconomics Econometrics II Option modules
Philosophy Philosophy of Mind 
Rationalism: Spinoza and Leibniz Philosophy of Mind Rationalism: Spinoza and Leibniz  You could choose up to two short Key Ideas modules. Current options include: Applied Ethics (Short) 
Philosophy of Science (Short) 
Intermediate Logic (Short) Applied Ethics (Short) Philosophy of Science (Short) Intermediate Logic (Short) Year 3 Dissertation PPE dissertation PPE Rationalism: Spinoza and Leibniz Option modules
PPE Ethics and Public Policy 
The Democratic Economy Ethics and Public Policy The Democratic Economy Economics
You'll choose at least two economics modules. Current choices include: Monetary Economics 
International Economics 
Bubbles, Panics and Crashes: A Long Period Assessment of the Causes and Consequences of Financial Crises Monetary Economics International Economics Bubbles, Panics and Crashes: A Long Period Assessment of the Causes and Consequences of Financial Crises Philosophy
You'll choose at least two philosophy modules. Current choices include: Contemporary Issues in Bioethics
From Marx to Critical Theory 
Property and Self-Ownership Contemporary Issues in Bioethics From Marx to Critical Theory Property and Self-Ownership

course_content.core:
Year 1 Economics
Economics I 
Mathematics I 
Probability I 
Statistics I Economics Economics I Mathematics I Probability I Statistics I Option modules
Politics
You'll choose modules from a list similar to the following: Option modules Politics What is Politics? 
Introduction to Democratic Politics 
Introduction to International Politics 
Introduction to Political Theory What is Politics? Introduction to Democratic Politics Introduction to International Politics Introduction to Political Theory Year 2 Economics Economics II - Microeconomics 
Economics II - Macroeconomics 
Econometrics II Economics II - Microeconomics Economics II - Macroeconomics Econometrics II Option modules
Politics
You may choose: one module from the Political Theory group
one module from either The State and Political Institutions or International Politics group one module from the Political Theory group one module from either The State and Political Institutions or International Politics group Current modules include:

Political Theory group Democracy and Struggles for Social Justice 
History of Political Thought 
State, Economy and Society 
Empire, War and Law Democracy and Struggles for Social Justice History of Political Thought State, Economy and Society Empire, War and Law The State and Political Institutions group Democracy, Autocracy and the State 
Politics in the United Kingdom 
The European Union: Politics and Policies 
Politics of Development 
The Rising Powers Democracy, Autocracy and the State Politics in the United Kingdom The European Union: Politics and Policies Politics of Development The Rising Powers International Politics group War and Peace 
The United States and Global Politics after the Cold War 
Human Rights and Wrongs in a Globalised World 
Critical Global Security Studies War and Peace The United States and Global Politics after the Cold War Human Rights and Wrongs in a Globalised World Critical Global Security Studies Year 3 Dissertation PPE dissertation PPE The Democratic Economy Option modules
PPE Monetary Economics 
International Economics 
Bubbles, Panics and Crashes: A Long Period Assessment of the Causes and Consequences of Financial Crises Monetary Economics International Economics Bubbles, Panics and Crashes: A Long Period Assessment of the Causes and Consequences of Financial Crises Politics
You'll choose at least two politics  modules. Current choices include: Terrorism and Counterterrorism 
Border Politics: Contemporary Perspectives on Sovereignty, Mobility and Citizenship

course_content.core:
Year 1 Approaches to Curatorial Practice
Objects in Focus (Curating)
The Art of Describing 
The Materials of Art and Architecture 
Theory for Art Historians Approaches to Curatorial Practice Objects in Focus (Curating) The Art of Describing The Materials of Art and Architecture Theory for Art Historians Year 2 Curatorial Internship
Group Exhibition Project Curatorial Internship Group Exhibition Project Year 3 You'll live, study, and potentially work abroad, combining university study with an international vocational opportunity. The department has a number of partners in Europe and China, but you’ll also be able to make use of the university’s partners in the World University Network, and partners beyond the university as well. During the year, you'll study modules on offer at your host institution and you'll pay a reduced fee to York for that year of study. Your assessment will be via two modules, in which you'll write a 2000-word essay, in English, discussing your experience abroad, and assessed by the York department. Year 4 Dissertation
